page.title: 17Beckwithshaw Church 2
page.content: N.W.window continued..In his hand a book,the second light depicts the angel with the key of the bottomless pit in one hand and a great chain in the other. Laid at his feet is the dragon he has subdued. The North East window portrays the angel standing outside the city wall with a sickle cutting a cluster of grapes to cast into the winepress of the wrath of God. The second shows the angel holding the great millstone which he is about to cast into the sea. The first light of the centre window describes the Apostles Vision of an Angel flying through heaven. he second one shows and angel standing before the golden altar, upon which he is offering incense. Suspended above is a golden censor to which a long chain is attached and held by the angel.
